references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces the Stable Diffusion model, which is a foundational model used in the ReVideo architecture for video generation and editing.

references.paper_title: Hierarchical text-conditional image generation with CLIP latents
references.reason: This paper introduces the use of CLIP for image generation, a technique that ReVideo leverages for accurate and localized control of video content.
This paper provides the theoretical foundation of diffusion models, which are central to the video generation and editing capabilities of ReVideo.

references.paper_title: Stable Video Diffusion: Scaling Latent Video Diffusion Models to Large Datasets
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Video Diffusion, a high-quality model specifically designed for video generation that the authors leverage in the ReVideo architecture.

references.paper_title: DragonDiffusion: Enabling drag-style manipulation on diffusion models
references.reason: This paper details the method used for drag-style motion control, a key component in ReVideo's trajectory-based motion editing capabilities.
